column4: Or, better yet, what would be the best way to extract information off of a bad hd? It's in a laptop, and I've tried BackTrack with no success, and booting from an external drive. Everything tries to access the internal HDD and freezes the boot up.
live cd it. :-)
That's what I've been trying to do, but livecd is trying to access the hard drive.
what is your boot order?
CDROM, HD1, HD2?
Make sure it is booting into the CDROM before HDs!
Change it in the bios.
Not sure, I believe it's usb-hdd, cd-rom, hdd1, pxe
Sorry, I think it's usb-hd, cd-rom, hd, pxe
boot cdrom first.
Will boot order affect LiveCD? I just looked and it boots the hd before cd. I've been over-riding the boot order each boot.
it tries to boot the external drive.
Just switch it to the CDROM and you'll be able to get into the LiveCD.
Easy data transfer.

Right, I have it set like that purposely. Each boot I have the option to override the boot order, and I select cd. I choose the option to enter LiveCD, and when it tries loading LiveCD, it tries to access the HD.
What LiveCD are you using?
I tried both Ubuntu Hardy normal install and BackTrack
the default action of a LiveCD should be to write to the memory.
I'm not sure why you're crashing on a boot, if you have it set up to read the cdrom drive first.
Okay, I wasn't sure. I think this laptop is cursed. :-)
Perhaps, try a different LiveCD?
lol I'm on 4 different downloads and 6 different burns, all with md5 verified. Unless you mean a different distro.
Try KillBill. >.>
So, I just took the hd out of the laptop, and it booted right up into livecd.
